title: North Third Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Richard Webb / Lewis Hill
images.caption: Lewis Hill. Basaltic escarpment above the North Third Reservoir. Southern view over the Kilsyth Hills.

images.title: Alan Pitkethley / Looking west from the trig point
images.caption: Looking west from the trig point on Lewis Hill. The edge of the cliff just in front of the trig point, with view of the North 3rd Reservoir.

images.title: Jonathan Clitheroe / Path up to the Trig pillar on Lewis Hill
images.caption: Path up to the Trig pillar on Lewis Hill

images.title: Mark Firth / Lewis Hill & North Third Reservoir
images.caption: Lewis Hill and North Third Reservoir

description: This peaceful circular walk takes you around the pretty North Third Reservoir near Stirling. There's a nice trail to follow around the peaceful lake with a climb to Lewis Hill on the eastern side. From here there are excellent views over the reservoir to the surrounding hills. The reservoir is very beautiful with some rugged scenery and woodland trails in the adjacent Middlethird Wood.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The hills and surrounding woodland make for a fine dog walk. You will probably see other owners on a fine weekend day.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head a mile south from the site and you could visit the nearby Loch Coulter Reservoir. To continue your walking around Stirling head up to the Wallace Monument or Dumyat for more great views. There's also nice trails around Plean Country Park, Torwood Castle and Tappoch Broch and Carron Valley Reservoir. Just to the north west of the water there's the Loup of Fintry where you'll find beautiful 94ft high waterfalls. The Stirling Walk explores the wonderful medieval castle with its fascinating history, beautiful gardens and excellent views. Head south west and you could visit Banton Loch on the lovely Colzium Estate near Kilsyth. The estate includes some peaceful waterside trails and the historic Colzium House. In the grounds there's a ruined 16th century castle and some beautiful gardens to admire.

display_address: Gateside Road, Torbrex, Stirling, Alba / Scotland, FK7 9QA, United Kingdom
